synopsis.text:
One sunny day on an Okinawan island, two young men's paths cross, forever altering their destinies. Shun Hashimoto, an aspiring novelist and openly gay, has left his past behind, including his disapproving family and a jilted fianc√©e. He finds solace in his new life with his grandmother, but everything changes when he encounters Mio Chibana, a melancholic high school student grappling with the loss of his parents. As they spend more time together, a bond develops between them. However, just as Mio begins to heal from his grief, he is sent away to an orphanage on the mainland.

Three long years pass with minimal communication between the two, until Mio suddenly reappears, confessing his feelings to Shun. Yet, Shun struggles to open his heart, haunted by his past and the extended silence. As they navigate the complexities of their relationship, Shun must confront his fears and decide if he's ready to take the next step with Mio. This captivating tale of love, loss, and self-discovery unfolds in "The Stranger by the Shore," a heartwarming anime that explores the intricacies of human connections and the power of love to heal and transform.
synopsis.author: mistral.mistral-large-2402-v1:0
